member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame
member.summary: Represents body tracking frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.BodyIndexMapBackground
member.summary: The pixel value that indicates the pixel belong to the background in the body id map.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.NumberOfBodies
member.summary: Get the number of people.
member.value: The number of detected bodies. 0 if the call fails.
member.remarks: Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the data contained in it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.DeviceTimestamp
member.summary: Get the body frame's device timestamp.
member.value: The timestamp of the body frame. If the frame is invalid this call will return 0. It is also possible for 0 to be a valid timestamp originating from the beginning of a recording or the start of streaming.
member.remarks: Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the data contained in it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.BodyIndexMap
member.summary: Get the body index map.
member.remarks:
Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the data contained in it.
Body Index map is the body instance segmentation map. Each pixel maps to the corresponding pixel in the depth image or the IR image.The value for each pixel represents which body the pixel belongs to. It can be either background () or the index of a detected .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.Capture
member.summary: Get the original capture that is used to calculate this frame.
member.remarks: Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the data contained in it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.GetBody(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the helper reference structure that can be used only on stack to get body data.
member.param: The index of the body of which the body id information is queried.
member.returns: Helper reference structure that can be used only on stack to get body data.
member.remarks: Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the data contained in it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.GetBodyId(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get the body id for a particular person index from this frame.
member.param: The index of the body of which the body id information is queried.
member.returns: Returns the body id. All failures will return .
member.remarks: Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the id of the body given a particular index.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.GetBodySkeleton(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get the joint information for a particular person index from this frame.
member.returns: If successful this contains the body skeleton information.
member.remarks: Called when the user has received a body frame and wants to access the skeleton of the body given a particular index.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.Reference
member.summary: Creates a duplicate reference to the same Frame.
member.returns: A new Frame object representing the same data.
member.remarks: Creating a reference to the same frame does not copy the frame, or the data stored in the frame, but creates a new managed object representing the same frame data. Each object must be independently disposed. The lifetime of the underlying frame data will be equal or greater than all of the referenced Frame objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Frame.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the resources held by the frame.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Joint

member.remarks: The position and orientation together defines the coordinate system for the given joint. They are defined relative to the sensor global coordinate system.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.JointConfidenceLevel
member.summary: This enumeration specifies the joint confidence level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.JointConfidenceLevel.None
member.summary: The joint is out of range (too far from depth camera)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.JointConfidenceLevel.Low
member.summary: The joint is not observed (likely due to occlusion), predicted joint pose

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.JointConfidenceLevel.Medium
member.summary: Medium confidence in joint pose. Current SDK will only provide joints up to this confidence level

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.JointConfidenceLevel.High
member.summary: High confidence in joint pose. Placeholder for future SDK

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.JointConfidenceLevel.Count
member.summary: The total number of confidence levels.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker
member.summary: Represents Azure Kinect body tracking component.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.Create(Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.Sensor.Calibration,Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration)
member.summary: Create a body tracking component.
member.param: The sensor calibration that will be used for capture processing.
The configuration we want to run the tracker in. This can be initialized with .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.SetTemporalSmooting(System.Single)
member.summary: Control the temporal smoothing across frames.
member.param: Set between 0 for no smoothing and 1 for full smoothing. Less smoothing will increase the responsiveness of the detected skeletons but will cause more positional and orientational jitters.
member.remarks: The default smoothness value is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.EnqueueCapture(Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.Sensor.Capture,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Add a Azure Kinect sensor capture to the tracker input queue to generate its body tracking result asynchronously.
member.param: Azure Kinect sensor capture returned by () from Azure Kinect Sensor SDK. It should contain the depth data for this function to work. Otherwise the function will return failure.
Time the function should block waiting to add the sensor capture to the tracker process queue.
member.remarks:
Add a Azure Kinect sensor capture to the tracker input queue so that it can be processed asynchronously to generate the body tracking result. The processed results will be added to an output queue maintained by this tracker instance. Call to get the result and pop it from the output queue. If the input queue or output queue is full, this function will block up until the timeout is reached.
Upon successfully insert a sensor capture to the input queue this function will return success.
This function will fail when either the tracker is shut down by API, or an internal problem is encountered before adding to the input queue: such as low memory condition, not containing the depth data, or other unexpected issues.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.EnqueueCapture(Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.Sensor.Capture)
member.summary: Add a k4a sensor capture to the tracker input queue to generate its body tracking result asynchronously.
member.param: Azure Kinect sensor capture returned by () from Azure Kinect Sensor SDK. It should contain the depth data for this function to work. Otherwise the function will return failure.
member.remarks: This is an infinite timeout function version of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.PopResult(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the next available body frame.
member.param: Time the function should block waiting for the body frame. 0 is a check of the queue without blocking.
If set to false, on timeout failure null will be returned instead of throwing exception.
member.returns: If successful this contains a handle to a body frame object.
member.remarks:
Retrieves the next available body frame result and pop it from the output queue in this tracker instance. If a new body frame is not currently available, this function will block up until the timeout is reached. The SDK will buffer at least three body frames worth of data before stopping new capture being queued by .
Upon successfully reads a body frame this function will return success.
This function will fail when either the tracker is shut down by API and the remaining tracker queue is empty, or an internal problem is encountered: such as low memory condition, other unexpected issues.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.PopResult(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the next available body frame.
member.param: If set to false, on timeout failure null will be returned instead of throwing exception.
member.returns: If successful this contains a handle to a body frame object.
member.remarks: This is an infinite timeout function version of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.Shutdown
member.summary: Shutdown the tracker so that no further capture can be added to the input queue.
member.remarks:
Once the tracker is shutdown, API will always immediately return failure.
If there are remaining catpures in the tracker queue after the tracker is shutdown, can still return successfully. Once the tracker queue is empty, the call will always immediately return failure.
This function may be called while another thread is blocking in or . Calling this function while another thread is in that function will result in that function returning a failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.Tracker.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the resources held by the tracker.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration parameters for a Azure Kinect body tracker.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration.SensorOrientation
member.summary: The sensor mounting orientation type.
member.remarks: Setting the correct orientation can help the body tracker to achieve more accurate body tracking results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration.ProcessingMode
member.summary: Specify whether to use CPU only mode or GPU mode to run the tracker.
member.remarks: The CPU only mode doesn't require the machine to have a GPU to run this SDK. But it will be much slower than the GPU mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration.GpuDeviceId
member.summary: Specify the GPU device ID to run the tracker.
member.remarks: The setting is only effective if the setting is set to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration.Default
member.summary: Default configuration setting for Azure Kinect body tracking component.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerProcessingMode
member.summary: Tracker processing mode types.
member.remarks: The CPU only mode doesn't require the machine to have a GPU to run this SDK. But it will be much slower than the GPU mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerProcessingMode.Gpu
member.summary: SDK will use GPU mode to run the tracker.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Kinect.BodyTracking.TrackerProcessingMode.Cpu
member.summary: SDK will use CPU only mode to run the tracker.
